intro: Oxydectes ruiziana var. caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed oxeye, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The variety 'caudata' is distinguished by its elongated, tapering leaves, which give it its common name.
